issue.title: Simple Expense Tracker
issue.body:
## Build a simple expense tracker

A basic web app to track expenses.

**Core Features:**
1. Add expense (description, amount)
2. List all expenses  
3. Show total

**Tech:**
- Next.js 14 App Router
- Tailwind CSS
- Store data in memory (no database)

**Pages:**
- / - List expenses and total
- Add expense form on same page

ems.task: Initialize Next.js 14 project with App Router, configure Tailwind CSS, TypeScript, and create all foundational configuration files (package.json, tsconfig.json, .gitignore, tailwind.config.ts, next.config.js)

workers.task: Initialize Next.js 14 project with App Router, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS configuration. Create package.json with dependencies (next@14, react, react-dom, typescript, tailwindcss, postcss, autoprefixer), tsconfig.json with strict mode and path aliases, .gitignore for Next.js, next.config.js with App Router enabled, tailwind.config.ts with content paths, postcss.config.js, and app/globals.css with Tailwind directives.

ems.task: Implement in-memory expense storage, data models/types, and core expense management logic (add, list, calculate total) in src/lib/storage.ts and src/types/index.ts

workers.task: Create TypeScript types and interfaces for expense tracking (Expense interface, ExpenseInput type, ExpenseStorage interface) in src/types/index.ts
Implement in-memory expense storage class with CRUD operations (add expense, list expenses, calculate total) in src/lib/storage.ts
Create expense management business logic service layer (validation, formatting, aggregation helpers) in src/lib/expense-service.ts

ems.task: Build the complete UI using Next.js 14 App Router - create app/page.tsx with expense form, expense list, total display, and Tailwind styling

workers.task: Create Tailwind layout and structure - app/layout.tsx with HTML shell, metadata, and body wrapper, plus app/globals.css with Tailwind directives
Build the main app/page.tsx with expense form, expense list component, total display, and all Tailwind styling for the complete UI
Create in-memory expense store in lib/expenses.ts with addExpense, getExpenses, and getTotal functions

ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

analysisSummary: Implement a minimal Next.js 14 expense tracker with in-memory storage, featuring a single-page interface to add, list, and total expenses, styled with Tailwind CSS.
